[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Per-byte gas bypass] Does the per_byte_serialized gas calculation properly account for all serialization costs, or can an attacker craft values that have high serialization cost but low key size to underpay for gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: CommonGasParameters::calculate_load_cost()] [Load cost manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the loaded parameter to receive incorrect gas charges, either paying less than actual costs or causing gas calculation overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Gas non-determinism] Are gas calculations guaranteed to be identical across all validators for the same operation, or can differences cause some validators to charge different gas amounts, leading to state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: GasParameters::zeros()] [Zero gas bypass] Can an attacker exploit configurations where gas parameters are set to zero to perform unlimited table operations without cost, enabling storage exhaustion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Gas overflow] When calculating total cost by adding base, per-byte, and load costs, can integer overflow occur with maliciously large inputs, causing wraparound to small gas values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [Gas-free probing] Can an attacker use contains_box operations with low gas cost to probe for table entries without paying appropriate gas, enabling information disclosure or storage enumeration attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: CommonGasParameters::calculate_load_cost()] [Legacy vs new gas] Can inconsistent use of load_base_legacy vs load_base_new create gas calculation discrepancies that validators exploit to charge different amounts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableData::get_or_create_table()] [Type layout confusion] Can an attacker create tables with incompatible type layouts that cause type confusion when the same TableHandle is accessed with different key/value types, breaking Move's type safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableData::get_or_create_table()] [Delayed fields bypass] The expect on line 232 assumes no delayed fields exist - can an attacker exploit delayed fields support to bypass this check and introduce delayed field types that cause deserialization failures? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Type argument mismatch] Do the ty_args validation checks properly ensure that the key type (ty_args[0]) and value type (ty_args[2]) match the table's declared types, or can type confusion attacks occur? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_table_handle()] [Field index corruption] Is HANDLE_FIELD_INDEX (0) guaranteed to always be the correct field index for the handle field, or can struct layout changes cause accessing wrong fields and corrupt the handle? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Reference type mismatch] Can the returned Reference value be cast to an incompatible type, bypassing Move's type system and enabling arbitrary memory access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Type tag spoofing] Can an attacker manipulate TableInfo's key_type or value_type tags to misrepresent the actual types, causing state corruption when the change set is applied? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Reentrancy attack] If table operations can trigger callbacks or other code execution, can reentrancy attacks occur where table_data is borrowed mutably while already borrowed, causing RefCell panic? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableData] [Interior mutability exploitation] Can the RefCell interior mutability be exploited to bypass Rust's borrowing rules and create multiple mutable references to table data simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Error code collision] Can the ALREADY_EXISTS error code (value 100 << 8 + 7) collide with other error codes in the system, causing error handling confusion or security checks to be bypassed? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [NOT_FOUND error bypass] Can an attacker exploit the NOT_FOUND error handling to make operations succeed when they should fail, enabling unauthorized data manipulation? (Medium)
